qas.question: Who appoints the prime minister of Swaziland?
What is the parliament of Swaziland known as?
What part of the Swaziland parliament is appointed by the King?
Why is the king allowed to appoint members of parliament?
Who does the prime minister appoint?
Who appoints both chambers of the Libandla?
Why are special intrests left out of parliment?

context: <a0_0><b5_0><b6_0>The king<b6_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/> appoints the prime minister from <b4_0>the legislature<b4_0/> and also appoints <a2_0>a minority<a2_0/> of legislators to both chambers of <a1_0>the Libandla<a1_0/> (parliament) with help from an advisory council. The king is allowed by the constitution to appoint some members to parliament for special interests. These special interests are citizens who might have been left out by the electorate during the course of elections or did not enter as candidates. This is done <a3_0><b7_0>to balance views in parliament<b7_0/><a3_0/>. Special interests could be people of gender, race, disability, the business community, civic society, scholars, chiefs and so on.
